action.action-desc: Ms. Norton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Transportation to develop and submit a report to Congress on recommendations to reduce train noise and vibrations near homes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Train Noise and Vibrations Reduction Act of 2022.

section.header: Recommendations to reduce train noise and vibrations near homes

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall develop and submit to Congress a report containing—

paragraph.text: recommendations to reduce train noise and vibrations near homes; and
estimates of the costs and benefits of each such recommendation.

subsection.text: The report required under subsection (a) shall, at a minimum, include such recommendations regarding—

paragraph.text: modifications to train and track maintenance procedures;
mitigation measures between tracks and homes;
the distance required between tracks and homes;
limits on the number of trains;
limits on the number of cars on trains;
